page.title: 13 A DAY AT A PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: We visited Dry Sandford school and talked to 3 pupils who were 8 years old.Their favourite SUBJECTS are Maths and Topic.The classroom was one big area with 7 tables,square and hexagonal shape.They have 2 playtimes. Sometimes they do cooking and sewing,which they all enjoy.There is an outdoor swimming pool in the school and we saw 21 pupils swimming,supervised by a teacher.There are 7 teachers,one of whom has been teaching for 7 years.During her career she has seen most changes in maths.The most important subjects in primary EDUCATION are READING,WRITING and Maths.The Classroom has changed alot as now there are changes instead of desks and the walls now are more colourful. (By Kerrie Orlando,Sharon Hurdidge, Katherine Jardine and Tracy Mofford).
